required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of Prehospital eFAST in Accelerating Time to Diagnostics or Definitive Treatment in the Emergency Department
clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Prehospital eFAST in Accelerating Time to Diagnostics or Definitive Treatment in the Emergency Department

brief_summary.textblock:
Actual literature has demonstrated that prehospital extended focused assessment sonography for trauma (eFAST) could impact on logistic and treatment decisions such as mode of transportation and choice of hospital destination.
However, there are no data with regard to in-hospital effects of a positive prehospital eFAST.
The main objective of this study was to evaluate the effects of prehospital eFAST driven decisions on in hospital time-to-definitive diagnostics or time-to definitive treatment, whichever came first, in a level 1 trauma center.
The goal is to define if this information could have a role in prioritizing patients' access to care in a population of abdominal trauma patients with A-AIS > 1 and a documented liver or spleen injury.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to definitive diagnostics or treatment
primary_outcome.description: Time from the ED arrival to CT scan imaging or surgical intervention (whichever came first)

secondary_outcome.description: Time from EMS dispatch to ED arrival

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity and specificity of prehospital eFAST
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity of prehospital eFAST calculated considering ED eFAST as the gold standard measure

arm_group.description: Patients with a positive prehospital eFAST, independently from their hemodynamic status or other vital signs

arm_group.arm_group_label: Negative or not performed prehospital eFAST
arm_group.description: Patients with a positive prehospital eFAST, independently from their hemodynamic status or other vital signs

intervention.intervention_name: prehospital extended focused assessment sonography for trauma
intervention.description: Sonographic procedure performed in the prehospital environment aiming at evaluating peritoneal free fluid in trauma patients
intervention.arm_group_label: Negative or not performed prehospital eFAST

study_pop.textblock: This study will involve all the patients admitted to the Maggiore Hospital's emergency department (ED) from January 2014 to December 2019 with a traumatic liver or spleen injury who survived enough time to get a CT scan or a surgical intervention within 3 hours from the ED admission

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients admitted to emergency department with a ICD-9-CM diagnosis of traumatic liver or spleen injury (codes 8640x, 8641x, 8650x, 8651x)
- Abdominal AIS ≥ 2
- CT scan or operating theatre admission performed within 180 minutes from ED admission
Exclusion Criteria:
- Death before CT scan or OR/Angio suite admission (missing primary outcome measure)
- Transferred to other hospitals before CT scan or operating room admission
- Missing data

facility.name: Maggiore Hospital Ospedale Maggiore Carlo Alberto Pizzardi AUSL di Bologna

reference.citation: Bøtker MT, Jacobsen L, Rudolph SS, Knudsen L. The role of point of care ultrasound in prehospital critical care: a systematic review. Scand J Trauma Resusc Emerg Med. 2018 Jun 26;26(1):51. doi: 10.1186/s13049-018-0518-x. Review.
